issues.description: The reference solution adds an `age` attribute and two-argument constructors (e.g., `Seal(String name, int age)`), but the problem specification and example usage in `Main.java` (and UML) expect single-argument constructors taking only the animal’s name. This mismatch will prevent code that follows the spec (e.g., `new Seal("Clarabelle")`) from compiling against the solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the extra `age` attribute and two-argument constructors from `Animal`, `Seal`, `Pig`, and `Goat`, and implement single-argument constructors (e.g., `public Seal(String name)`) consistent with the UML and example usage.
